description: '''Harm's Way'''{{refn|name=Name|group=N|The band often drops the apostrophe and present their name as '''HARMS WAY''' on album art, merchandise and other promotional materials for "aesthetic reasons".<ref name="toiletovhell1">{{cite podcast| url= http://www.toiletovhell.com/toilet-radio-gets-swole-with-harms-way/| title= Toilet Radio Gets Swole with Harm's Way| website= Toilet Ov Hell Radio| host= Thrashnkill, Joe| date= January 3, 2018| time= 50:25| access-date= July 29, 2018}}</ref><ref name="metalsucks2">{{cite web| last = Neilstein| first = Vince| title = Apostrophe-Challenged Harms Way Release Ripping New Single 'Human Carrying Capacity'| work = [[MetalSucks]]| date = December 6, 2017| url = http://www.metalsucks.net/2017/12/06/apostrophe-challenged-harms-way-release-ripping-new-single-human-carrying-capacity/| accessdate = July 29, 2018}}</ref>}} is an American [[hardcore punk]] band from [[Chicago, Illinois]], formed in 2006. The band started as a side project, but ended up becoming a more serious and full-time band in their later years. Harm's Way has since released four studio albums: ''Reality Approaches'' (2009), ''Isolation'' (2011) and ''[[Rust (album)|Rust]]'' (2015) and several EPs. On February 9, 2018, the band released their critically acclaimed Metal Blade Records debut, titled ''[[Posthuman (Harm's Way album)|Posthuman]]''. They have been recognized for their unique blend of [[heavy metal music|metal]], [[industrial music|industrial]], and hardcore music.
